p: To examine whether serum cytokine profiles differ in patients with CRS and infection, we first identified serum cytokines correlated with grades of CRS: interferon γ, IL-6, interleukin 10 and 15, and tumor necrosis factor α ( Supplementary Figure 1A). We then compared the serum cytokine panels in patients with CRS who had infections with those in patients who did not but found no difference in these serum levels ( Supplementary Figure 1B). Considering the timing of infections by organism type, bacterial infections occurred a median of 18 days (IQR, 9–29) after CTI, followed by fungal infections (median 23 days; IQR, 20–29 days) and viral infections (median 48 days; IQR, 20–80 days).
